args:
A revived and fully powered Morsayati has
begun killing dragons and spreading his evil
across the world. Meanwhile, the prince and his
allies attempt to stop the newest scheme of
Prince Emile, who has started waging war using
the ancient weapons known as androids.
Hmph. A mere trifle. I expected far more\nresistance from a dragon.
Still, if this is all that stands in my way,\nI will soon rid this world of their fell\npresence and claim it for myself!
This...this cannot be. What happened to\nthe beautiful lake that used to be here?
Dragons control the flow of mana—and\nmana, in turn, governs nature.
When a dragon is slain, the land festers,\nwaters cloud, and winds blow ill.
Damn that Morsayati! He seeks to warp\nthe very world itself!
If this continues, he'll turn the entire\nkingdom into a barren wasteland.
We have to stop him—whatever the cost.
You have not often been about the castle\nof late. I must confess to missing the little\naudiences you used to deign to grant me.
Your tongue is as honeyed as ever, Chelle.\nYou hardly have reason to seek out\nmy company.
Oh, such a sad thing to say.\nAnd here I'd come all this way\nbearing a fine gift for you!

I am certain you are aware of this,
Empress, but some three centuries ago,
the Dyrenell Empire crafted a weapon for
the express purpose of slaying dragons.
Of course I am aware of this.\nWhy bring it to my attention now?
Because, Your Majesty, I have found\nand revived these weapons of war.
These androids truly are a marvel.\nEven a dragon is no match for them!
They need no training, feel no pity,\nand know no remorse—plus they are\njust EVER so adorable!
Best of all, so long as you have the\ncontrol element in hand, they will\nhappily obey your every command.
I must have some, Chelle. Please!
Patience, my dear brother! Patience.\nI will lend them to you once I am finished\nwith my initial trial run.
Of course! I've never been able to deny a\nrequest from my adorable baby brother.
Although I must confess to finding the\nEmpress rather...spirited at present.
If she continues apace, ancient weapons\nsuch as these may no longer be necessary.
At which point, I fear WE will\nno longer be necessary.
So this is the control element, eh?
How unexpectedly sloppy of Chelle to\nleave it out in the open like this.

So long as I possess this, the androids
are mine. And once I DO control them,
everyone will agree that I should have
been the one in charge all along!
Finally, the world will see my talents,\nand everyone will know the quality of\nPrince Emile! Aaaah ha ha ha!
Don't you find it rude, Cat Sìth?
He apparently didn't consider whether\nor not you would really leave something\nthat impurr-tant lying around.
Well, I suppose my brother's absurd\noverconfidence is the reason things are\ngoing so smoothly, so let's call it a wash.
Don't disappoint me now, Emile;\nI am expecting big things from you!\nEeee hee hee hee!
With Morsayati restored to his full power,\nhe has started to claim the world as his own.

But as the Other travels the world slaying
the very dragons that form its foundation,
a conspicuously powerful army has begun
its own incursion on this land.
An army being led by my own brother, Emile!
But even though he is my blood, I cannot\npermit his unjust actions to continue.
Yes! Yeeees! Destroy them, my pets!\nKill any who might oppose the Empire,\nand all who would dare oppose ME!
Kill everyone in this pathetic village!\nGrant them no quarter!
So the insects have scurried out from\ntheir holes yet again, eh?
Androids! Crush these filthy insects\nonce and for all!
We have to evacuate the villagers!
That's a great plan, boss, but it means\nwe gotta deal with these weirdos what\nyer brother has fightin' for him.
I've been smashin' and slicin' 'em\nall day and they don't even flinch.\nIt's creepin' me the hell out!
And check out what happens when I\ntry to fill 'em with arrows!
I've shot a lot of arrows in my life,\nbut I've never seen any of 'em\nBOUNCE OFF somebody before!
By Ilia... Is the Empire truly so mad\nthat they have unleashed androids?!
You're going to have to fill me in\non that term, Cleo.
A detailed explanation can come later.\nAll you need know now is that these\nare very dangerous foes. Use due caution.
Caution will only take us so far when\nour enemy has seemingly limitless\nnumbers on their side!
Aaaah ha ha ha! Yes! Go, my androids!\nGo, my soldiers! Go, my fiends!\nCrush my enemies into dust!
We can't stay here... Everyone, fall back!\nFall back and protect the villagers!
